TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UploadStringCompletedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instances of this class are passed to the <xref:System.Net.UploadStringCompletedEventHandler>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates asynchronously uploading a string.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#38](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.uploadstrin_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#38](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.uploadstrin_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#38](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.uploadstrin_1_1.vb)]
The following method is called when the upload completes.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.uploadstrin_1_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.uploadstrin_1_2.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.uploadstrin_1_2.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the server reply to a string upload operation that is started by calling an method.
Docs.value: A array that contains the server reply.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You should check the <xref:System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs.Error%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs.Cancelled%2A> properties to determine whether the upload completed. If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs.Error%2A> property's value is an <xref:System.Exception> object or the <xref:System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs.Cancelled%2A> property's value is `true`, the asynchronous operation did not complete correctly and the Result property's value will not be valid.
## Examples The following code example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.net.uploadstrin_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.uploadstrin_1.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#39](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.net.uploadstrin_1.vb)]
